definitions.text: a mild viral infection involving the nose and respiratory passages (but not the lungs)
examples: will they never find a cure for the common cold?
the coldness made our breath visible
come in out of the cold

definitions.text: the sensation produced by low temperatures
examples: the cold helped clear his head

definitions.text: having a low or inadequate temperature or feeling a sensation of coldness or having been made cold by e.g. ice or refrigeration
examples: if you are cold, turn up the heat

definitions.text: extended meanings; especially of psychological coldness; without human warmth or emotion
having lost freshness through passage of time
examples: dogs attempting to catch a cold scent
had her lines cold before rehearsals started

definitions.text: lacking originality or spontaneity; no longer new
so intense as to be almost uncontrollable

examples: a cold response to the new play

definitions.text: unconscious from a blow or shock or intoxication
of a seeker; far from the object sought
